alert.note: Alert for Chowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 12:18AM EST until December 18 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast North Carolina, including the following counties, Camden, Chowan, Gates, Pasquotank and Perquimans. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1218 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hertford, Winfall, Ryland, Sunbury, Belvidere, Hobbsville, Tyner, Rockyhock, Valhalla, Corapeake, Snug Harbor, Cape Colony, Hickory Crossroads, Peach, Whiteston, Nicanor, Sandy Cross, Gliden, Smithtown and Sign Pine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
